revised_title: The Role of the Cervical Sympathetic in Pupil Dilation and the Nature of Gravity
tldr: The author conducted experiments on a monkey to understand the role of the cervical sympathetic in pupil dilation. They discovered that the dilator fibers of the iris are derived from the anterior root of the second dorsal nerve. Additionally, the author presents a theory that challenges the traditional understanding of gravity and suggests that air has no weight, pressure, or density.
